title: 🔄 [转发] 【musk】 作者描述了左翼活动人士对其家庭进行的威胁和骚扰，包括公开诽谤、死亡威胁、电话骚扰等，并提到这些行为是更广泛的社会问题的一部分。
content:
### 📊 AI分析

【中文翻译】
他们试图将这一切遗忘，但我们不能忘记左翼在2020年后对美国实施的恐怖统治。这是他们对我及我的家人所做的一些事情，目的是让我闭嘴：

当我在西雅图时，他们在我的社区张贴了关于我的疯狂谎言的海报，并附上我的家庭住址，指示活动人士到我家门口示威。后来，他们给我几百个邻居寄信，声称我是纳粹白人至上主义者。死亡威胁、提及我的家人，一切都有。有几次，我们不得不带着孩子离开城镇。

其中一名活动人士在公园里找到了我的一个孩子和保姆，对他大喊大叫，直到他开始哭泣。我的儿子回家时非常害怕，所以我查出了这个人是谁——社区里的一名软件开发人员——拿到了他的电话号码，给他打了电话，说了一些“有说服力”的话，并强迫他在电话上向我儿子道歉。我确保他比我儿子更害怕。

同一组织在微软内部组织员工向我妻子的老板发送电子邮件，声称她是白人至上主义者。幸运的是，他觉得一个亚洲人是白人至上主义者很奇怪，知道这都是捏造的。我追踪到了主谋，几个月后他“巧合”地被解雇了。他高估了自己的地位，低估了我的。

然后是我们的私人号码接到电话和短信。威胁要强奸我的妻子并杀害我的孩子。有一次，我与FBI合作调查此事，但肇事者使用了号码隐藏应用程序，执法部门无能为力。我以为在圣路易斯有线索，并雇了一名私家侦探进行调查，但线索断了。我们加固了家，研究了法律。我准备杀死任何越过门槛的人。

机构也参与其中。组织活动毁坏我的声誉，操纵我的维基百科页面，取消我的演讲活动，并将我列入SPLC和ADL的网站，试图让我被社交媒体封禁。审查机构在我背后贴上了目标，联邦政府也怂恿他们。幸运的是，他们都失败了。

多年来，我拒绝公开承认我家人经历的很多事情——我不想让我的敌人满意——但现在是将这一切公之于众并解决的时候了。我的经历并不独特；许多其他保守派也面临类似的情况。这关乎CRT、DEI和所有其他知识问题，但更重要的是，这关乎拥有一个没有威胁、暴力、恐吓和疯狂的社会。

【内容概要】
作者描述了左翼活动人士对其家庭进行的威胁和骚扰，包括公开诽谤、死亡威胁、电话骚扰等，并提到这些行为是更广泛的社会问题的一部分。

【关键标签】
政治迫害, 家庭安全, 社会问题, 保守派, 左翼活动

【重点提示】
- 内容标记：无
- 重要数据：**几百个邻居**收到了诽谤信件
- 引用内容：无

### ℹ️ 详细信息

- **📅 发布时间**: 1h
- **🔗 原文链接**: [点击查看]()
- **📌 推文ID**: `1882136803467231257#m`

### 📝 原文

- **📌 推文ID**: `1882136803467231257#m`

They're going to try to memory-hole this, but we can't forget that the Left put America through a reign of terror after 2020. This is some of what they did to me and my family, in an attempt to shut me up:

When I was in Seattle, they put up posters around my neighborhood with insane lies about me and my home address, instructing activists to show up at my door. Later, they sent letters to a few hundred of my neighbors, claiming I was a Nazi white supremacist. Death threats, references to my family, the whole deal. A few times, we had to take the kids and leave town.

One of these activists found one of my children at the park with the babysitter and yelled at him until he started crying. My son came home terrified, so I figured out who this person was—a software developer in the neighborhood—got his number, called him, delivered some "persuasive" words, and forced him to apologize to my son over the phone. I made sure he was much more frightened than my son.

The same group organized employees within Microsoft to bomb my wife's boss with emails claiming she was a white supremacist. Thankfully, he thought it was strange for her to be an Asian white supremacist and knew it was all a fabrication. I tracked down the ringleader and, "coincidentally," he was fired a few months later. He overestimated his position and underestimated mine.  

Then there were the calls and texts to our private numbers. Threats to rape my wife and murder my children. At one point, I was working with the FBI about it, but the perpetrators had used number-cloaking apps and there was nothing law enforcement could do. I thought we had a lead in St. Louis and hired a private investigator to look into it, but the trail went cold. We fortified our home and studied the law. I was prepared to kill anyone who crossed the threshold.

The institutions got in on it, too. Organized campaigns to ruin my reputation, manipulate my Wikipedia page, cancel my speaking engagements, and list me on the websites of the SPLC and ADL, in an attempt to get me banned from social media. The censorship apparatus put a target on my back and the federal government egged them on. Fortunately, they all failed.

For years, I refused to publicly acknowledge much of what happened to my family—I didn't want to give my enemies the satisfaction—but now is the time to get it out and address it. My experience is hardly unique; many other conservatives have faced similar circumstances. It's about CRT, DEI, and all of the other intellectual issues, but even more, it's about having a society free of threats, violence, intimidation, and madness.

title: 🤖 🔄 [转发] 【musk】 引用推文讨论了关于Stargate项目的5000亿美元投资数字的荒谬性，并分析了相关公司的财务状况和投资能力。
content:
### 📊 AI分析

【中文翻译】
Stargate是个好名字，但5000亿美元这个数字太荒谬了，除非软银打算卖掉他们所有的阿里巴巴和ARM股份，否则没人应该认真对待这个数字。

软银有380亿美元现金，1420亿美元债务，根据彭博社的数据，每年产生约30亿美元的自由现金流。他们拥有1430亿美元的ARM股份和180亿美元的阿里巴巴股份。如果他们开始出售ARM股份，他们的持股价值会迅速大幅下降。

甲骨文有110亿美元现金，880亿美元债务，每年产生100亿美元的自由现金流。

OpenAI正在烧钱。

MGX没有承诺具体数字，它是一个1000亿美元的基金。最乐观的情况下，可能有10%的资金会投入这个项目。

英伟达会限制他们对任何一家模型公司的投资（他们不需要垄断）。可能是50亿美元。

除非前面提到的软银出售ARM股份，否则可能在未来几年内筹集到500亿美元的股权融资。显然可以为GPU融资并在合资企业中增加债务。

离5000亿美元还差得远。每个人都应该开始发布1万亿美元的人工智能项目新闻稿。

顺便说一句，我喜欢MGX这个生物科技公司的股票因为这个消息上涨了33%。

如果你是专业投资者或分析师，并且你把这个5000亿美元的数字当真——或者更糟，写了关于这个的*报告*——你应该羞愧地辞职。

【内容概要】
引用推文讨论了关于Stargate项目的5000亿美元投资数字的荒谬性，并分析了相关公司的财务状况和投资能力。

【关键标签】
#Stargate #投资分析 #财务状况 #人工智能 #软银

【重点提示】
- 内容标记：🤖
- 重要数据：**5000亿美元**、**380亿美元**、**1420亿美元**、**30亿美元**、**1430亿美元**、**180亿美元**、**110亿美元**、**880亿美元**、**100亿美元**、**1000亿美元**、**50亿美元**、**500亿美元**
- 包含引用内容

### ℹ️ 详细信息

- **📅 发布时间**: 2025-01-23 16:25:23 CST
- **🔗 原文链接**: [点击查看](https://twitter.com/GavinSBaker/status/1882081746877063677)
- **📌 推文ID**: `1882081746877063677#m`

### 📝 原文

- **📌 推文ID**: `1882081746877063677#m`

Stargate is a great name but the $500b is a ridiculous number and no one should take it seriously unless SoftBank is going to sell all of their BABA and ARM.

SoftBank has $38b in cash, $142b in debt and generates $3ish billion in FCF per BBG.  They own $143b in ARM and $18b in BABA.  If they start selling ARM, their stake will be worth much less very quickly.

Oracle has $11b in cash, $88b in debt and generates $10b in FCF.

OpenAI is burning cash.

MGX did not commit to a number and is a $100b fund.  Maybe 10% of the fund goes into this best case.

Nvidia will limit how much they invest in any one model company (they don’t need a monopsony). Maybe $5b.

Barring the aforementioned SoftBank ARM sale, might be able to put together $50b in equity funding over several years.  Can obviously finance the GPUs and put debt on the JV.

Nowhere close to $500b.  Everyone should just start issuing press releases for $1 trillion AI projects.

BTW love it that the ticker MGX which is a biotech company is up 33% on this.

If you a professional investor or analyst and you took $500b at face value - or even worse wrote a *note* about this - you should resign in disgrace.

title: 🔄 [转发] 【musk】 作者通过分析一个J6案件的细节，揭示了司法系统中的偏见和政治迫害，指出被告因轻微行为被过度指控和判刑。
content:
### 📊 AI分析

【中文翻译】
这真是非同寻常，而且是最糟糕的那种。

引用内容：
我随机挑选了一个J6案件来审查，因为我想看看情况有多糟糕。

我告诉你，我随机挑选的这个案件没有让我失望。这名被告进入国会大厦并走过走廊。他没有被指控暴力行为。他没有破坏任何东西。他没有伤害任何人。他被陪审团判处19个月监禁，检察官对他的指控过度，以至于应该被称为恶意起诉，而法官则对检察官提出的每一项要求都照单全收。

这些文件中最令人震惊的部分是，政府引入了一段22分钟的视频蒙太奇，拼接了当天发生的关键突破。

他们向陪审团展示了这段视频，即使相关被告在这段视频中只出现了不到60秒。

相关被告没有暴力行为。他只是在国会大厦的走廊里与人群一起走过，在照片中看起来像是在进行步行游览。

剩下的21分钟，展示了当天最暴力的部分拼接在一起。

幸运的是，这名被告似乎有称职的律师，他们提交了排除这段视频的动议。被告的律师辩称，这段视频蒙太奇极具偏见，因为它向陪审团展示了一段22分钟的视频，其中他们看到的只是当天最极端的部分，但相关被告在这段视频中只出现了六秒，并且是平静地走来走去。

此外，被告的律师辩称，华盛顿特区的大多数陪审团成员都是联邦雇员。这段视频旨在激怒陪审团，它没有证明价值，因此违反了联邦证据规则401（顺便说一下，这在法学院的第一天刑事程序课上就会教到）。

地区法院法官贝茨拒绝了这一动议，并允许检察官包括这段视频蒙太奇。

我愿意用我所有的财产打赌，提交一段22分钟的视频蒙太奇，展示当天你能找到的最恶劣的暴力行为，而相关被告在这段视频中只出现了六秒，并且是平静地走来走去，这是极具偏见的，并且侵犯了被告的正当程序权利。

这个人被判有罪并被判处19个月监禁。

让我再说一遍，这个人因为走过国会大厦8分钟而被判处19个月监禁。

我花了两个小时阅读了这个案件文件中的所有文件。被告提交的每一项动议都被拒绝，而政府提交的每一项动议都被批准。

他们将一项本应导致50美元罚单的非法侵入轻罪变成了五项轻罪和一项重罪指控，通过指控被告违反了一项要求特勤局封锁他所在区域的法规，而他们并没有这样做，他们还指控他违反了一项要求他们证明迈克·彭斯在他走过走廊时在大楼内的法规，而他并没有，最后他们使用了一项最高法院已经否决的安然法规。

这名被告不得不花费两年时间和可能数十万美元的律师费，因为他在大楼内呆了20分钟并走过走廊。

而这只是我深入研究的第一个案件。

想象一下，如果我们有时间深入研究每一个案件的细节，阅读所有文件并编制一份关于所犯正当程序违规数量的报告。你知道这叫做新闻工作。似乎只有朱莉·凯利和其他少数人知道如何做到这一点，尤其是在J6方面。

人们需要看到监狱的内部。这远远超出了检察官的自由裁量权。这是直接的政治迫害。但这里最大的问题是那些照单全收的法官。
作者：Insurrection Barbie

【内容概要】
作者通过分析一个J6案件的细节，揭示了司法系统中的偏见和政治迫害，指出被告因轻微行为被过度指控和判刑。

【关键标签】
司法不公、政治迫害、J6案件、正当程序、检察官自由裁量权

【重点提示】
- 内容标记：无
- 重要数据：**19个月监禁**、**22分钟视频蒙太奇**、**六秒**、**50美元罚单**、**两年时间和可能数十万美元的律师费**
- 引用内容：作者引用了一个J6案件的详细分析，揭示了司法系统中的偏见和政治迫害。

### ℹ️ 详细信息

- **📅 发布时间**: 2h
- **📅 发布日期**: 2025-01-23 21:24:50
- **🔗 原文链接**: [点击查看](https://twitter.com/JDVance/status/1882412172967616745)
- **📌 推文ID**: `1882412172967616745#m`

### 💬 引用推文

**@Insurrection Barbie**：
I picked a J6 case at random to review because I wanted to see how bad it was. 

And let me tell you the random one I picked did not disappoint. This defendant went into the capital and walked down the corridor. He was not accused of violence. He did not break anything. He did not hurt anybody. He was sentenced by a jury to 19 months in prison he was overcharged by the prosecutor to the point where it should be called malicious prosecution, and a judge rubber stamped every single thing the prosecutor asked for.

The most egregious part of these filings was that the government introduced a 22 minute video montage that spliced together key breaches that occurred that day. 

They introduced that video to a jury even when the defendant in question is only shown on that video for less than 60 seconds.

The defendant in question was not violent. He was walking through a hallway in the capital building with the crowd, he looked like it was a walking tour in the picture still shot. 

The remaining 21 minutes, shows the most violent portions of the event spliced together. 

Luckily, this defendant seems to have had competent attorneys who filed a motion to exclude this video. The defendant’s lawyers argued that this video montage is highly prejudicial because it shows a jury a 22 minute video where all they see are the most extreme parts of the whole day, but the defendant in question is only on that videotape for six seconds and is seen walking around peacefully. 

Further, attorneys for the defendant argued that the majority of the jury in Washington DC is made of a federal employees. This video is meant to inflame a jury, it has no probative value, and therefore is a violation of federal rule of evidence 401 (which by the way they teach like on the first day of criminal procedure in law school). 

District Court Judge Bates declined the motion and allowed the prosecutor to include the video montage. 

I would be willing to bet everything I own that submitting a 22 minute video montage that shows the most egregious acts of violence you can find from that day when the defendant in question is on that video for only six seconds and is seen walking calmly is highly prejudicial and a violation of the defendants due process rights.

This person was found guilty and sentenced to 19 months in prison.

Let me repeat that again, this person got 19 months in prison for walking through the capital for 8 minuets. 

It took me two hours to read through all of the documents that were in this case file. Every motion submitted by the defendant was denied, and every motion submitted by the government was granted.

They turned a trespass misdemeanor that would have result in a $50 ticket into a 5 misdemeanors and a felony charge by charging the defendant with a statute that would have required the Secret Service to rope off the section he was in, which they did not, they also charged him with a statute that would have required them to prove Mike Pence was in the building at the time he walked through that corridor, he was not, and finally they used an Enron statue that the Supreme Court struck down. 

This defendant had to spend two years and probably hundreds of thousands of dollars in attorneys fees for spending 20 minutes in the building and walking through the corridors.

And this is just the first case I dug into. 

Imagine if we had the time to dig into the details of each and every single one of these cases, read all the filings and compile a report on the amount of due process violations that were committed. You know it’s called journalism. Something that only Julie Kelly and a small few others seem to understand how to do as it relates to J6. 

People need to see the inside of jail cells. This is so far beyond prosecutorial discretion. This is straight up political persecution. But the biggest problem here are the judges that rubber stamped all of it.


### 📝 原文

This is extraordinary, and in the worst way.

title: 🚀 💬 [引用] 【musk】 埃隆·马斯克批评不合理的法规是对人类的隐形税收，并以SpaceX被罚款**14万美元**为例，说明这些法规阻碍了创新和太空探索。
content:
### 📊 AI分析

【中文翻译】  
🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸 自由的美国！！！🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸  

引用内容：  
埃隆：不合理的法规是对人类的隐形税收  

“你真的可以把美国和许多国家——可以说欧盟更糟糕——想象成格列佛，被无数小绳子绑住。  

任何一条单独的法规都不算太糟，但你有数百万条。  

最终，你什么都做不了。  

这是对消费者、对人民的巨大税收。  

只是他们没有意识到，这种巨大的税收是以不合理法规的形式存在的。  

我给你举一个最近的疯狂例子。  

SpaceX被美国环境保护局（EPA）罚款**14万美元**，理由是他们在Starbase将饮用水倒在地上。  

我们所在的地方是热带雷暴区，水从天上掉下来是常有的事。  

你知道，那只是用来冷却发射台的水，没有任何危害。  

他们也同意：是的，没有任何危害。  

我们说，好吧，既然没有危害，你们却要我们支付**14万美元**的罚款？  

是的，因为你们没有许可证。  

我们不知道在一个淡水从天上掉下来的地方，零危害的淡水倒在地上还需要许可证。  

我的意思是，有时候雨下得太大，路都被淹了。  

所以我们说，这有什么意义？  

他们说，除非你们支付这**14万美元**，否则我们不会处理你们关于星舰发射的任何申请。  

他们就是在勒索我们。  

我们说，好吧，所以我们支付了**14万美元**。  

照这个速度，我们永远也到不了火星。”  

来源：The All-In Podcast，2024年9月  
作者：Mario Nawfal  

【内容概要】  
埃隆·马斯克批评不合理的法规是对人类的隐形税收，并以SpaceX被罚款**14万美元**为例，说明这些法规阻碍了创新和太空探索。  

【关键标签】  
#法规阻碍 #SpaceX #罚款 #创新 #太空探索  

【重点提示】  
- 内容标记：🚀（涉及太空探索）  
- 重要数据：**14万美元**  
- 包含引用内容，埃隆·马斯克批评不合理法规对创新的阻碍。

### ℹ️ 详细信息

- **📅 发布时间**: 2h
- **📅 发布日期**: 2025-01-23 21:24:50
- **🔗 原文链接**: [点击查看](https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1882410078269329860)
- **📌 推文ID**: `1882410078269329860#m`

### 💬 引用推文

**@Mario Nawfal**：
ELON: IRRATIONAL REGULATIONS ARE AN INVISIBLE TAX ON HUMANITY

“You really can think of the United States and many countries – it's arguably worse in the EU – as being like Gulliver, tied down by a million little strings.

Any one given regulation is not that bad, but you've got millions of them.

Eventually, you just can't get anything done.

This is a massive tax on the consumer, on the people.

It's just that they don't realize that there's this massive tax in the form of irrational regulations.

I'll give you a recent example that is just insane.

SpaceX was fined by the EPA [U.S. Environmental Protection Agency] $140,000 for, they claimed, dumping potable water on the ground, drinking water.

This is at Starbase, and we're like, we're in a tropical thunderstorm region.

That stuff comes from the sky all the time.

You know, it was just water to cool the launch pad during liftoff.

And there's zero harm done.

And they agree: Yes, there's zero harm done.

We're like, okay, so there's no harm done, and you want us to pay a $140,000 fine?

Yes, because you didn't have a permit.

We didn't know there was a permit needed for zero-harm, fresh water being on the ground in a place where fresh water falls from the sky all the time.

I mean, sometimes it rains so much the roads are flooded.

So we're like, how does this make any sense?

And they were like, we're not going to process any more of your applications for Starship launch unless you pay this $140,000.

They just ransomed us.

And we're like, okay, so we paid $140,000.

At this rate, we're never going to get to Mars.”

Source: The All-In Podcast, September 2024


### 📝 原文

🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸 FREE AMERICA!!! 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

I would have to work and expend efforts to hire people.

I would have to basically plead to hire people.

The other thing is that in big companies, usually, it's really hard to get rid of low performers.

Elon is very friendly to, by default, getting rid of low performers.

I had to fight for people to keep them on the team.

He would by default want to remove people.

So, keep a small, strong, highly technical team.”

Source: Sequoia Capital March 2024,@karpathy

【中文翻译】
🚨DOGE在对抗浪费的战争中面临西瓜、鲸鱼和贝壳珠

DOGE首次窥探联邦支出，揭示了官僚膨胀的荒谬范围：

从一个西瓜推广委员会提高费用以对抗“大哈密瓜”，到海军为“意外”炸毁鲸鱼的文件，再到博物馆归还140年前的贝壳珠。

伊隆和他的效率团队不仅仅是在削减脂肪——他们仅在12月的法规中就导航了12,174页的迷宫。

虽然批评者嘲笑DOGE的2万亿美元节省目标，但政府琐事的庞大规模表明有很多可以削减的地方。

当我们在“儿童咬力研究”上花费税款时，也许是时候进行重置了。

来源：华尔街日报@DOGE

DOGE揭露了联邦支出中的荒谬浪费，包括西瓜推广、海军文件和博物馆归还贝壳珠等，同时批评者对其2万亿美元的节省目标表示怀疑。

DOGE's first peek into federal spending reveals the absurd scope of bureaucratic bloat:

Elon and his efficiency squad aren't just trimming fat - they're navigating a maze of 12,174 pages of December regulations alone. 

While critics mock DOGE's $2T savings target, the sheer volume of government minutiae suggests there's plenty to cut. 

When we're spending tax dollars on "child bite strength studies," maybe it's time for a reset.

当我们在“儿童咬合力研究”上花费纳税人的钱时，也许是时候进行重置了。

title: 🔄 [转发] 【musk】 佛罗里达州州长德桑蒂斯在与记者的对话中纠正了记者对非法移民的称呼，强调应使用“非法外国人”而非“无证移民”。
content:
### 📊 AI分析

【中文翻译】
🚨 天啊。这位记者刚刚称非法移民为“无证移民”，德桑蒂斯纠正了他，记者因此重新表述了问题。

记者：佛罗里达州有数十万无证移民——

州长德桑蒂斯：——根据特朗普政府的规定，法定术语是非法外国人。无证就像——如果我开车时忘记带钱包。这是故意非法入境。他们不仅仅是“缺少一份文件”。他们违反了法律。而且在很多情况下是在卡特尔组织的帮助下。

content:
### 📊 AI分析

【中文翻译】
南港的怪物不仅仅杀害了三个白人小女孩。他用刀刺了她们数百次，还几乎以同样的次数刺伤了其他近十名女孩，甚至在她们逃跑时将受伤者拖回中心，以便他能进一步切割她们。后来，他会嘲笑警察，并表示他很高兴她们死了。

斯塔默的政府知道这一切，并且基于他的阅读清单，知道他的反白人动机，但没有向任何人透露这些血腥的细节。

相反，与主流媒体一起，英国政府和警方称那些暗示他有种族动机的说法为“错误信息”和“虚假信息”。他们将那些抗议这些谋杀的人描绘成“极右翼”，并因社交媒体帖子逮捕并监禁了数百人。警方甚至威胁要从海外引渡任何谈论此事的人。

在这一切中，他们未能保护英国最脆弱的群体——年轻的白人女孩。你看到模式了吗？

【内容概要】
引用内容揭示了南港怪物对白人女孩的残忍杀害及其反白人动机，批评英国政府和警方对此事的处理方式，包括隐瞒真相和对抗议者的打压。

### 📝 原文

The Southport monster didn’t just kill three little white girls. He stabbed them hundreds of times, and he stabbed almost a dozen other girls almost as many times, even dragging the wounded back into the center as they were fleeing so he could cut them up them even more. Later he would laugh at the police and express that he was glad they were dead.

Starmer’s government knew all of this, and knew of his anti-white motivations, based on his reading lists, and told no one the gory details. 

Instead, together with the legacy media, the British government and the police called it “misinformation” and “disinformation” to suggest that he had a racial motive. They painted those protesting over the murders as the “far right” and arrested and jailed hundreds for social media posts. The police even threatened to extradite anyone from overseas for talking about it. 

And in all of this, they failed to protect Britain’s most vulnerable—young white girls. Do you see a pattern?
